thread.title: Middlesbrough's Liverpool and Manchester City transfer target Ben Gibson to cost £25m if they go down
thread.title_full: Middlesbrough's Liverpool and Manchester City transfer target Ben Gibson to cost £25m if they go down

author: Simon Bird
title: Middlesbrough's Liverpool and Manchester City transfer target Ben Gibson to cost £25m if they go down
text:
Sport Middlesbrough's Liverpool and Manchester City transfer target Ben Gibson to cost £25m if they go down 24-year-old vital to a defence that's conceded fewer goals than the Reds and Arsenal was in the most recent England squad Share Gibson's England call-up last week will have added a few more quid to his valuation (Photo: Getty) Share Get     
Ben Gibson will cost the Premier League big guns £25million in the summer. 
The Middlesbrough defender is his relegation-threatened club's prize asset and will be sold at a premium if the Teessiders do drop out of the top flight. 
Gibson, 24 , has just broken into the England squad and has been a key part of Boro's top-six ranked defence this season. 
He is poised to continue his rise up the ranks of English football this summer, with Manchester City and Liverpool leading the chase to sign him. Chairman Gibson will drive a hard bargain over his nephew's signature (Photo: Getty) 
However, chairman Steve Gibson — who is also his uncle — will not let him go on the cheap. 
Second-bottom Boro are fighting for their lives and face a pivotal trip to 17th-placed Swansea at the weekend. 
While they have had a problem scoring goals, Gibson has led a defence that's conceded just 33 goals – fewer than top-four contenders Liverpool and Arsenal. poll loading
